1.name: Ali
1.medical_history:
Allergic to penicillin, has asthma, had an ACL surgery in 2020
VISIT: Patient reported feeling nauseous and lightheaded over the past 24 hours. No vomiting, fever, or recent trauma. Likely cause is dehydration or a viral illness. Blood pressure was slightly low. No signs of acute distress or neurological abnormalities. Key points: 1. Stay hydrated, sip fluids throughout the day. 2. Rest and avoid sudden movements to prevent dizziness. 3. Monitor symptoms; seek care if they worsen. 4. Remind all medical professionals of penicillin allergy. (Medication: Meclizine 25 mg (for nausea and dizziness). Take 1 tablet by mouth every 8 hours as needed. May cause drowsiness; avoid driving or operating heavy machinery. Do not take with alcohol.) - Added by omarhossameldin2016@gmail.com on 2025-07-30

2.name: Peter
2.current_medication: Ketoconazole 2% shampoo -  - 3x/week; Hydroxyzine 25 mg - 25 mg - at night

appointments.symptoms: Itchy skin and hair, tried creams but it gets itchier everywhere

post_visit_records.visit_summary: Persistent itching on skin and scalp. Tried OTC creams with no relief. No new soaps/detergents. Diagnosis: Likely chronic dermatitis or possible fungal infection. Key points: 1. Stop all current creams. 2. Avoid scratching to prevent infection. 3. Keep skin dry and clean.

medications.name: Ketoconazole 2% shampoo
medications.dosage: Use on scalp and affected skin areas 3x/week. Leave on for 5 mins before rinsing. May cause dryness—use mild moisturizer after. Hydroxyzine 25 mg
medications.frequency: Take 1 tablet at night for itching. May cause drowsiness. Avoid alcohol.

post_visit_records.instructions: Don’t use scented soaps or lotions. Wear loose, breathable clothing. Watch for redness, swelling, or oozing—may indicate infection. Return in 2 weeks if no improvement. Sooner if rash worsens. Consider skin scraping or allergy testing if unresolved.
post_visit_records.next_appointment: Return in 2 weeks if no improvement.
